means: 作物收割后遗留在地里的残茎，茬子

sentence.Network_en: There he stood: hair in wild tangles, dark stubble shadowing his chin.
sentence.Network_cn: 他站在那儿，头发乱成一团，下巴上一片黑胡茬。

sentence.Network_en: His face was covered with the stubble of several nights.
sentence.Network_cn: 他几天没刮胡子，脸上胡子拉碴。

sentence.Network_en: The stubble was burning in the fields.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French stuble, from Latin stupla, stupula, variants of stipula 'straw'

entry.def: Stubble is the short stalks which are left standing in fields after corn or wheat has been cut.

example.ex: The stubble was burning in the fields.

entry.def: The very short hairs on a man's face when he has not shaved recently are referred to as stubble .

example.ex: His face was covered with the stubble of several nights.
example.tran: 他几天没刮胡子，脸上胡子拉碴。

means.word_mean: 1. material consisting of seed coverings and small pieces of stem or leaves that have been separated from the seeds
